text: [Music]
once upon a time a poor peasant lived in
a small rundown hut in a faraway village
with his wife and children his youngest
was a daughter named rah-rah was as
beautiful as she was wise she would take
the farmers loan mule to the forest to
graze by dawn and sing all day to the
birds and flowers she would return only
at sundown one evening just as she had
returned and had helped her mother cook
the soup there was a knock at the
farmers door I'll get it
the peasant opened the door to see a
bear standing no more him please do not
be afraid sir I won't hurt you who is it
dear nothing what do you want I live in
a castle beyond the three mountains I
get lonely there I have heard your
daughter's sing in the forest she truly
has the voice of an angel if she would
sing to me every day only for the next
one year I would pay her so handsomely
that you will never know poverty again
and she would have everything she
desires how can I send my daughter with
a bear as you can see I am NOT a regular
bear I will make sure she is well taken
care of and is happy I must ask her
first wait here a second so the peasant
went back in and spoke to his family Oh
daughter will not go with a bear but
mother he says he will pay us handsomely
we need the money we need a couple of
new meals the roof needs repairing new
shoes and clothes for everyone but you
will stay away from us raw it is only
for a year mother plus don't you
remember the prophecy this can't be it
you never know mother-father what
prophecy just something a soothsayer
said would happen when you turned 18 and
you turned 18 just last week well what
is it that when you turned 18 you would
undertake a journey that would make you
a queen
what no whatever it is I can't let my
daughter go with a bear
look had this bear been dangerous he
would have attacked us father is right I
think I must go so Ron decided to go
with the bear the bear asked her to sit
on his back and hold his coat as he sped
off across the three mountains to his
majestic palace here this will be your
home for the next one year milady and if
you need anything at all just ring the
silver bell and your wish shall be
fulfilled but please do not step out
into the garden after sunset
thank you mr. bear you must be hungry
would you like some hot stew I should
like that very much
[Music]
raaah eight to her heart's content and
then wished to rest for she was very
tired
raaah rung the silver bell and
immediately there appeared the softest
bed there ever could have been with
silken cushions in white and gold every
day rod would sing to the bear in the
morning and they would sit and talk
throughout the day but the bear would
vanish just before sunset
and never tell her where he was going
one night
rah could not sleep so she went out for
a walk into the palace when she heard
the most beautiful music there ever
could have been
somewhere out in the garden by the
fragrant fountain someone was playing
the violin she could not see who it was
she wanted to step out but she
remembered that the bear had asked her
not to step into the garden after sunset
so she stood where she was mesmerised by
the melody for months this continued rah
would sing to the bear by day and at
night she would listen to the music
being played in the garden as happy as
she was with the bear rah was missing
her family terribly she became sad one
morning your songs were beautiful but
they sounded so sad today what is the
matter is something bothering you I just
missed my family so much it's been
months since I saw them I can take you
to them if you like
will you certainly but you must promise
me that you will not tell them what you
saw here I promise
so the bear took Raw back to her
father's house which was no longer a
rundown hut but rather a grand mansion
and there was no sign of poverty in that
rich household there was great rejoicing
when the family saw rah mother-father
rah my child I am seeing you after so
long
how have you been my child and how do
you do mr. bear I am fine sir I shall be
back tomorrow to pick her up we missed
you so much
so how is it there rah let her eat in
peace rah come into the kitchen with me
please help me get the dessert didn't
you want to let her eat in peace finish
your food
come with me rah rah so tell me is
everything all right with you is there
anything unusual that is happening there
mother everything is fine I am sure you
do look well but is there anything
unusual about the Bears mansion
rah wanted to tell her mother everything
about the mysterious music that somebody
played every night so desperately that
in the spur of the moment she forgot
that the bear had forbidden her to speak
about it and blurted it all out to her
mother well now when you go back to the
Bears Palace when you hear the music at
night hide behind the fountain and stay
there till daybreak when he comes to
wash his face in a fountain you shall
see his reflection in the water and know
who it is but mother the beer has
forbidden me to step into the garden
well you are employed by him to sing and
not to follow orders now do as I say
so the next night when rah had reached
the Bears palace again though she was
tired she stayed awake waiting for the
music to begin then she tiptoed into the
garden behind the fountain at daybreak
she looked into the water as the figure
came to wash his face and there in the
water she saw the most beautiful the
most handsome face she had ever seen in
her life goodness you're so beautiful
[Music]
you you defied what I asked of you I'm
sorry but I was just so curious if you
had just waited one more month you might
have freed me but now the curse can
never be broken
look I'm sorry there must be something I
can do I became this way because of a
curse from the witch Alaura she wants me
to marry her daughter for she thinks her
daughter must marry the most handsome
man in the world when I refused she put
this curse on me and gave me one year to
find my love I had found you raah
but you ruined everything and now I must
go to her palace
I liked you even when you were a bear is
there no way I can rid you of the curse
there is a way but it is impossible tell
me and I shall do it
allora lives in a castle on the east of
the Sun and the west of the Moon you
must reach there in seven days and seven
nights that is the only way wait where
is this place
Brahe was not the one to give up so she
walked for five days and five nights
into the deepest forests asking every
creature and bird she encountered if
they knew were the witch alura's castle
on the east of the sun and the west of
the moon was but no one seemed to know
on the sixth day she saw an old hag
[Music]
looking for the rich LRA's castle rah
yes do you know where it is they say it
is on the east of the Sun and the west
of the moon I don't know where it is
but someone might I think you should go
to the home of the Northwind if anyone
would know he would if anyone could get
you there he could thank you
how do I get to the home of the
Northwind my horse will get you there
when you do
just whisper in his ear to go back home
and he will come back to me take this
with you you might find some use for it
thank you so much the ears are
indifferent and a horse appeared rah
wrote it far far away until she came to
the home of the north wind of the seven
days and seven nights that she had to
reach a Loris Castle on the east of the
Sun and the west of the moon this was
the sixth night she told everything to
the north wind the castle on the east of
the Sun and the west of the moon
have been there but once and it was so
far away please mister Northwind I need
to get there by tomorrow night it takes
me all of my energy and more to get
there I shall have to spend the whole of
tonight preparing for the journey we
shall leave at the first break of dawn
till then rest here so Rob rested in the
home of the Northwind and the next
morning at the first break of dawn both
of them set off towards the castle on
the east of the Sun and the west of the
Moon they flew the whole day and most of
the night until finally they reached
alura's Castle this is it
I can fly not a flap further you must go
on alone from here Thank You mr.
Northwind thank you so much
now go on do you have barely a few hours
left before the eighth day's dog Rob ran
to the palace Alaura saw her come and
had the Prince locked in seven prisons
to keep rah away from him I see you got
here but you've only reached the castle
on the east of the Sun and the west of
the Moon and not the Prince where is he
in seven prisons if you can get to him
before dawn we shall see about the curse
take me to where the prisons are and let
no one be there very well so alura's
guards took her to the seven prisons and
left her there there in the seventh
prison was the prince when she was all
alone rah removes the key the old woman
have given her and open
of the seven doors and reached the
prince you you were here
yes I reached you now your curse will be
broken no not yet
Oh Laura must have another trick up her
sleeve my my you managed to get to him
did you well well
nice effort so now he will be free of
the curse right you are in my castle in
my prison and you expect me to set you
free he must marry my daughter
but the condition of the curse as per
the curse if my love gets to me before
the end of seven days and seven nights I
get to choose who I marry well the curse
says that if your love gets to you
before the end of the seven days and
seven nights you can put up a condition
which your bride-to-be must fulfill to
be wedded to you and there is no
condition my daughter cannot fulfill I
don't love your daughter she will never
be happy with me Oh Laura love and all
that nonsense tell me your condition
well then let love be the condition when
two people love each other their hearts
move in tandem as one and what better
way to assess that than with music my
daughter does sing beautifully condition
approved so it was arranged for the
Prince to have his violin alura's
daughter tried to sing along with the
violin but she couldn't
[Music]
you and I forever stop stop that much
should sound so now it was rostered the
prince played and Roz sang and together
they created a melody so mesmerizing
that even Elora was entranced in ecstasy
I don't understand my daughter Jo sings
beautifully but then why couldn't she
sing with the prince because we do not
love each other mother and hence our
hearts do not move in tandem while Ross
and the princes to let them be married
mother free him of the curse
so Elora free the Prince of her curse
and she and her daughter vanished
forever to goodness knows where rah and
the Prince left the palace and lived
their lives happily together ever after
[Music]
